author: signor_rossi
message:
I like the new gwenview also very much.
Some suggestions for the preview mode though:
When resizing the preview split view with the mouse and passing e.g. from 2 columns to 1 column in the left view a lot of unused space can remain on the left when I don't resize exactly to the size of the pictures. Some automatic adjustment would be fine, either moving the separator to the left until the space is used or incrase the size of the preview pictures on the left until the space is used.
Then depending on the format (16:10/4:3) of the pictures, the format of the monitor(s) and the location of the toolbar (I like it on the left) someone uses it could be convenient to allow to split the preview mode horizontally.

Sorry for my convoluted english, it's not my mother tongue.
Bye, signor_rossi.

author: tjong
message:
About switching between images with the scroll wheel: my first thought is always that the scroll wheel will scroll the current image, not switching images. It's happened so many times and often there is an old video in the cache which makes Gwenview lock up for a moment - when all I wanted was to scroll the current image.

Maybe it's just me, or isn't the intuitive behavior to just scroll the image - as in many other applications?

author: Aurélien
message:
@tjong: I agree with you, it's more natural for me to scroll with the mouse wheel. This really is a case where 50% of users expect one behavior while the others expect another behavior.
As a result this will be a user option, and default will stay to scrolling.

author: mutlu
message:
Aurelien, could you please inform us about what is happening to WengoPhone? It is short of actually working (uvc, better H232 protocol support, etc.), but it seems noone but you spent any time on it recently. Also, its maintainership has been transferred to a r&d company. What does all this mean?

Thanks,

mutlu

author: Aurélien
message: @mutlu: that's quite offtopic, but I'll answer nevertheless. Since the OpenWengo team got laid off, I am not involved anymore in the WengoPhone project. I know however that the R&D company you are refering to is MBDSYS and that they have been working with Wengo on the WengoPhone since the beginning of the project (the original SIP stack has been implemented by MBDSYS), so I believe the project is in good hands.

author: multu
message: Thanks for the quick response! And good to hear that development is continuing. :)
